commit_list.message:
Trying out an alternate mapping for paragraphs.

By default vim's paragraph text object motions consider a paragraph to
be one or more completely empty lines (i.e. no whitespace) between
blocks of text.

I think I'd prefer to be able to jump to the first non-whitespace
character of the next block instead. And I'd like lines to be treated as
empty even if the contain some whitespace.

One caveat is that in visual mode we should jump to the last line of the
block, instead of the first, to allow for neat selection of blocks.

I also added a mapping to easily start a new block with your cursor on
the first line of an existing one.

commit_list.message:
Give virtualenv's activate script a helping hand.

It sets a custom $PS1 including the name of the current virtualenv. But
my PROMPT_COMMAND also over-rides $PS1 based on the exit status of the
last command. So I now also include the value of $VIRTUAL_ENV if present.

commit_list.message:
Fix for tailing shorter files

Wasn't doing anything near what was intended and only accidentally
produced a sane looking result for longer files.

This version seems to work now but is still clunky and convoluted. I'm
hoping I can revisit and come up with something nicer.

commit_list.message:
Fix issues found with valgrind

Had some uninitialised memory and unclosed file pointers in src/wc.c.

There were also some issues with getpwuid and getgruid reported in
src/ls.c, but Googling seems to indicate those are false positives due
to the glibc implementation using an area of static memory for the
return values (i.e. the leak doesn't grow with repeated calls).

commit_list.message:
Use scandir's POSIX std type signature by default

Older versions of OS X use a definition for the 3rd and 4th
parameters to scandir that differs from the POSIX standard.

Use compiler macros to check the POSIX version and switch between
possible implementations.

commit_list.message:
Added oauth support for twitter.

Only require single-user support so it doesn't do the full multi-step auth ritual.
Just presumes you've already authorized yourself via something like twurl, and then
copy and pasted your access token & secret into the settings file.

commit_list.message:
Rework 'back' functionality.

It's pretty important that our 'back' doesn't work just like the
browser's history.back() so that we don't get stuck in unecessary
loops. Particularly after using something like the search form.

To that end I've replaced the existing history.back() and
history.replaceState() stuff with a kind of 'curated' history which
should just contain the visited and activated URLs that we care about.
commit_list.repo_description: A ten foot UI for your HTPC in HTML + JS (again)

commit_list.message:
Switch back to kiosk mode.

Can't find a way to fullscreen app mode. Neither is really ideal.

There doesn't seem to be a way to mix the options together for all the
desirable attributes, e.g:

    - Full-screen
    - No status bar
    - No shared session
    - Custom icon
    - Custom window title
    - Smooth video
    - $! returns killable PID
commit_list.repo_description: A ten foot UI for your HTPC in HTML + JS (again)

commit_list.message:
Use mtime in place of created_at for VideoFiles.

The file modification time is more useful than the real created_at,
particularly when creating DB records from an existing library of files.

(Accidentally included the series part of this in the previous commit,
and had pushed before I noticed it. Ho hum.)

commit_list.message:
Revert HTTParty upgrade. Breaks TVDB & IMDB party.

HTTParty now uses Procs in its HTTParty::Response objects, and since
Procs are un-serializable it breaks the uses of Marshall.dump for
caching in HTTParty::Icebox. Both TVDBParty & IMDBParty rely on this.

See here for more details:
https://github.com/jnunemaker/httparty/issues/143

commit_list.message:
Optimise focusNearest for pages with 500+ links.

Was seeing stuttering scroll on the files index page with a slower
machine. Seems the link offset look-ups were a bottle-neck, so I've
added an offset cache. Which will of course need updating if any
ajax stuff is added affecting the number of links or their position.

commit_list.message:
Catch 404 etc when image is unavailable.

Just returning means we display a blank image due to the code in
app/views/. A 404 probably means the image is gone for good. Perhaps a
better strategy would be to clear out the .image property.

We could then have a separate populate task to fetch missing images.
